snippet.textDisplay: Yeah, the only minor complain I have about the bosses is that you only use the chain against them...not that's really bad, but the combat moves with the sword, knives and scythe are stylish and tricky, and I would've loved to use them against the bosses...
snippet.textOriginal: Yeah, the only minor complain I have about the bosses is that you only use the chain against them...not that's really bad, but the combat moves with the sword, knives and scythe are stylish and tricky, and I would've loved to use them against the bosses...

snippet.textDisplay:
I just beat the game. Gotta say...That was the most badass fight in a long while; coupled with this theme, and it's glorious!

Xenoblade and Last Story were fun games, but I tended to overlevel and it was too easy. This game, being more of an action game, had a more satisfying boss fight, imo.
snippet.textOriginal:
I just beat the game. Gotta say...That was the most badass fight in a long while; coupled with this theme, and it's glorious!

Xenoblade and Last Story were fun games, but I tended to overlevel and it was too easy. This game, being more of an action game, had a more satisfying boss fight, imo.

snippet.textDisplay: the boss was definitely enjoyable. Music fit well and the story was emotional a great addition along with xenoblade and the last story for my wii :).

snippet.textDisplay:
I thought this music fit the final boss perfectly. This whole game is grotesque, but it asks the question of whether one can see past the veil of the monster into the humanity inside. The whole game does this, from the monster design (shoving human faces at you at every opportunity), to the backstory behind the Masters of the 13 towers, to of course the relationship between Aeron and Elena.

This music captures that theme pretty damn well, in my opinion, while still being exciting as all hell.
snippet.textOriginal:
I thought this music fit the final boss perfectly. This whole game is grotesque, but it asks the question of whether one can see past the veil of the monster into the humanity inside. The whole game does this, from the monster design (shoving human faces at you at every opportunity), to the backstory behind the Masters of the 13 towers, to of course the relationship between Aeron and Elena.

This music captures that theme pretty damn well, in my opinion, while still being exciting as all hell.

snippet.textDisplay: It is true that the music fits the game's environment and anbience very well. My concern is that there are several sections in this piece that could have been a lot better, thus "not worthy" of being used along with the Liebestraum theme (which is a masterpiece indeed).
snippet.textOriginal: It is true that the music fits the game's environment and anbience very well. My concern is that there are several sections in this piece that could have been a lot better, thus "not worthy" of being used along with the Liebestraum theme (which is a masterpiece indeed).

snippet.textDisplay:
Pretty much everything Atlus has made on the DS never made it to Europe and adding to that, here's a lot more over the years:

Tales of: Destiny, Destiny 2, Legendia, the Abyss.
Xenogears, Xenosaga 1 & 3, Suikoden 3, FF IV took 15 years, FF VI took 13 years, Chrono Trigger took 14 years, Mario RPG took 12 years, etc etc etc.

When games don't get localiced to EU, Nobody cares. When games don't get localiced to American areas, then there is an uproar.
snippet.textOriginal:
Pretty much everything Atlus has made on the DS never made it to Europe and adding to that, here's a lot more over the years:

Tales of: Destiny, Destiny 2, Legendia, the Abyss.
Xenogears, Xenosaga 1 & 3, Suikoden 3, FF IV took 15 years, FF VI took 13 years, Chrono Trigger took 14 years, Mario RPG took 12 years, etc etc etc.

When games don't get localiced to EU, Nobody cares. When games don't get localiced to American areas, then there is an uproar.
